TEI.2.document_title: H H League to Stephen F Austin, 01-02-1830

barker_notes.barker_summary: H. H. League to Austin, January 2, 1830. Informing Austin that Nestor Clay is insubordinate and declares that he will not obey the tax law.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: Compare Austin to Bell, Mar. 17 and Apr. 4, 1829
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 315-316

*div1 type="summary"* *p*H. H. League to Austin, January 2, 1830. Informing Austin that Nestor Clay is insubordinate and declares that he will not obey the tax law.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Col. *person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*Dear Sir but a short time since *person_mentioned*Mr Nester Clay */person_mentioned*came to this *location_mentioned*place*/location_mentioned*. I accidentally fell in his *person_mentioned*company*/person_mentioned*, and he told me he had been wishing to speak to me on the subject of the Tax law and proceeded to make many violent remarks amongst which was the following: I will never pay one cent of the taxes while I am able to raise arms against it the best *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*in the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*will oppose it with force and arms. You would be astonished to know who they are. You had better pay it yourself if it costs all you are worth, than to attempt collecting the Taxes, by God we will have a *location_mentioned*Boston*/location_mentioned* Tea Scrap of it, we will come armed and show you whether you will collect it. I know my *person_mentioned*neighbors */person_mentioned*will join me, and if you report us in a state of rebellion, we will take no other notice of you than to Tar and feather you, and many other remarks of a similar kind.*person_mentioned* Mr. T. M. Duke*/person_mentioned* and*person_mentioned* H. Cheves*/person_mentioned* was present and paid attention to the conversation, he is the sort of *person_mentioned*charactors */person_mentioned*that has always kept this *location_mentioned*community */location_mentioned*in an uproar, and has always broke down order and established confusion it is my duty as an *person_mentioned*officer of this municipality*/person_mentioned* to inform you of all such outrage, for now is the time to put a check to Such *person_mentioned*Charactors*/person_mentioned*, this is therefore to inform your self and the honorable the *person_mentioned*Commissioner General of the State */person_mentioned*that the facts as above stated is just and true all of which I am prepared to prove*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*H H. League*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*First Regedor of the municipality of Austin*/person_mentioned*.*/p* *p**date_mentioned n="01-02-1830">January 2nd 1830*/date_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
